TemplatedActionPermissionsKeys:
Keys are used to control which global properties and subproperties can be modified. 

Keys are specified as dotted properties, like this: 'parent.child.child.child'.
actionGroupDistributionsAdd:
Use this form to add an **Action Group Distribution** 
(creating custom or linking a global one).

In an Action Group Distribution of type **None**
the actions within will be executed normally.

In an Action Group Distribution of type **Session** or **Page Load**
is possible to create Action Groups that will be executed with
a certain probability.

With type **Page Load** the distribution is determined on each page load,
while using type **Session** will lock the distribution until the session
expires.
 
It is possible to specify a **comment** to be associated with the operation in
the entity **history** when creating a custom Action Group Distribution.
actionGroupDistributionsCreate:
Use this form to create a new **Action Group Distribution**.

In an Action Group Distribution of type **None** 
the actions within will be executed normally.

In an Action Group Distribution of type **Session** or **Page Load** 
is possible to create Action Groups that will be executed with 
a certain probability.

With type **Page Load** the distribution is determined on each page load, 
while using type **Session** will lock the distribution until the session
expires.

It is possible to specify a **comment** to be associated with the operation in
the entity **history**.
actionGroupDistributionsUpdate:
Use this form to update the details of an **Action Group Distribution**.

It is possible to specify a **comment** to be associated with the operation in
the entity **history**.
actionGroupsCreate:
Use this form to create a new **Action Group**.

Every Action Group within a distribution will be associated with a 
**probability** of execution.

It is possible to specify a **comment** to be associated with the operation in
the entity **history**.
actionGroupsUpdate:
Use this form to update the details of an **Action Group**.

It is possible to specify a **comment** to be associated with the operation in
the entity **history**.
actionsCreate:
Use this form to create a new **Action**.

It is possible to specify a **comment** to be associated with the operation in
the entity **history**.
actionsUpdate:
Use this form to update the details of an **Action**.

It is possible to specify a **comment** to be associated with the operation in
the entity **history**.
appEnvironmentsCreate:
Use this form to create a new **Environment**.

It is possible to specify a **comment** to be associated with the operation in
the entity **history**.
appEnvironmentsMain:
In this area you can manage your **Environments**.

For every Environment will then be possible to get a snipped to **install**
it in your application.
appEnvironmentsUpdate:
Use this form to update the details of an **Environment**.

It is possible to specify a **comment** to be associated with the operation in
the entity **history**.
appPlatformRevisionsMain:
In this area you can manage the **Platforms Revisions**
linked with in your **Application**.
appPlatformsMain: In this area you can manage the **Platforms** installed in your **Application**.
appRevisionsMain:
In this area you can manage your **Application Revisions**.

When a revision is ready it must be **finalised** to be linked to an environment
and used on the application.

To make further changes it then necessary to clone it to a new revision.

To allow to test the changes within the Revision 
it is always possible to **preview** a revision,
even when it is not finalised.
appRevisionsUpdate:
Use this form to update the details of a **Revision**.


It is possible to specify a **comment** to be associated with the operation in
the entity **history**.
applicationsMain:
In this area you can manage your **Applications**.

An **WEB** application is normally associated with domain and represents a
website manages by the Organization.

In this tag manager version the only application type supported is **WEB**.
conditionsCreate:
Use this form to create a new **Condition**.

It is possible to specify a **comment** to be associated with the operation in
the entity **history**.
conditionsUpdate:
Use this form to update the details of a **Condition**.

It is possible to specify a **comment** to be associated with the operation in
the entity **history**.
eventsCreate:
Use this form to create a new **Event**.

It is possible to specify a **comment** to be associated with the operation in
the entity **history**.
eventsUpdate:
Use this form to update the details of an **Event**.

It is possible to specify a **comment** to be associated with the operation in
the entity **history**.
exceptionsCreate:
Use this form to create a new **Exception**.

It is possible to specify a **comment** to be associated with the operation in
the entity **history**.
exceptionsUpdate:
Use this form to update the details of an **Exception**.

It is possible to specify a **comment** to be associated with the operation in
the entity **history**.
globalActionsMain:
In this area you can manage your **Global Action Group Distributions**.

It's then possible to use a Global Action Group Distribution 
within a **Rule** for a **Tag**.
globalTriggersCreate:
Use this form to create a new **Global Trigger**.

It is possible to specify a **comment** to be associated with the operation in
the entity **history**.
globalTriggersMain:
In this area you can manage your **Global Triggers**.

It's then possible to use a Global Trigger when creating a **Rule**
for a **Tag**, connecting a set of rules to the trigger.
globalTriggersUpdate:
Use this form to update the details of a **Global Trigger**.

It is possible to specify a **comment** to be associated with the operation in
the entity **history**.
ingestEndpointDataMapsAdd: Use this form to add a variable to your **Ingest Endpoint Data Map**.
ingestEndpointDataMapsMain:
In this area you can manage your **Ingest Endpoint Data Maps**.

The Data Map will define the format and the types of the data payload
of your **Endpoint**
ingestEndpointEnvironmentsMain:
In this area you can manage your **Ingest Endpoint Environments**.

For every Environment will then be possible to get a snipped to **use** your
endpoint in your application.
ingestEndpointRevisionsMain:
In this area you can manage your **Ingest Endpoint Revisions**.

When a revision is ready it must be **finalised** to be linked to an environment
and used on the application.

To make further changes it then necessary to clone it to a new revision.

To allow to test the changes within the Revision  it is  possible
to **preview** the **payload** format and types.
ingestEndpointRevisionsColumnBytes: This will show the trend in the endpoint revision **transferred bytes**.
ingestEndpointRevisionsColumnRequests: This will show the trend in the endpoint revision **number of requests**.
ingestEndpointsMain:
In this area you can manage your **Ingest Endpoints**.

Using the Endpoint you can transfer data to a number of cloud providers and services.

It is possible to connect the endpoint to an action in the data manager,
feed it using a pixel, or programmatically with code.
ingestEndpointsColumnBytes: This will show the trend in the endpoint **transferred bytes**.
ingestEndpointsColumnRequests: This will show the trend in the endpoint **number of requests**.
organizationUsersInvite: Use this form to invite a new **user** to your **organization**.
organizationUsersMain:
In this area you can manage your **organization users**.

It is **not possible** to edit or delete the **currently logged** user from here.
organizationUsersUpdate:
Use this form to change the permissions of a **user**.

Can View is the minimum level of permissions for a user.
organizationUsersColumnOwner: The organization owner cannot be removed from the organization, and he can only be and admin.
organizationUsersColumnPermissions:
These are the permissions for the **user**.

Can View is the minimum level of permissions for a user.
organizationUsersColumnTwoFactorAuth: To activate two-factor Authentication, the user must go to: *Manage Account â†’ 2-Factor Auth*
organizationsMain:
In this area you can manage your **organizations**.

Using the organizations you can create different billing
entities with their own set of users and services.
platformRevisionsUpdate:
Use this form to update the details of a **Platform Revision**.


It is possible to specify a **comment** to be associated with the operation in
the entity **history**.
ruleGroupsCreate:
Use this form to create a new **Rule Group**.

It is possible to specify a **comment** to be associated with the operation in
the entity **history**.
ruleGroupsUpdate:
Use this form to update the details of an **Rule Group**.

It is possible to specify a **comment** to be associated with the operation in
the entity **history**.
rulesCreate:
Use this form to create a new **Tag Rule**.

It is possible to specify a **comment** to be associated with the operation in
the entity **history**.
rulesMain:
In this area you can manage your **Tag Rules**.

**Rule groups** represent a set of rules where only 
the first matching rule will be executed.
All the rule groups defined will be executed.

Every rule will have a **trigger** that will define events and conditions to
execute a set of **Actions**.

The **Action Groups** containing a set of **Actions** are created within
an **Action Group Distribution**.

In an Action Group Distribution of type **None**
the actions within will be executed normally.

In an Action Group Distribution of type **Session** or **Page Load**
is possible to create Action Groups that will be executed with
a certain probability.

With type **Page Load** the distribution is determined on each page load,
while using type **Session** will lock the distribution until the session
expires.

All the actions within an **Action Groups** will be executed.
rulesUpdate:
Use this form to update the details of an **Tag Rule**.

It is possible to specify a **comment** to be associated with the operation in
the entity **history**.
tagsMain:
In this area you can manage your **Tags**.

**Head tags** will not represent an area in the App and usually provide actions
without a visual effect or with effects that manifests
with a fixed position in the page.

**Placements** represent an area in the app and usually are connected with actions
that produce effects in the placement area or triggers connected with the placement position within 
the page.
tagsColumnHeight:
This is the **Height** of the **Placement**.

This value is defined only for tags of type Placement.
tagsColumnWidth:
This is the **Width** of the **Placement**.

This value is defined only for tags of type Placement.
userInvitationsMain: In this area you can see and manage the user **invitations** still pending.
